Description: Bust of Severus II, radiate, draped & cuirassed; right. (obverse)
Emperor standing right, receiving small Victory on globe from Jupiter, leaning on sceptre; left. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: This coin does not feature in the De Salis registers but is documented as forming part of his collection.
Bibliographic references: RIC6 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. 6: from Diocletian's reform (AD 294) to the death of Maximinus (AD 313) (60a, p.670)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Severus II
Acquisition name: Donated by: Count John Francis William de Salis
